newsitem.title: USA: Koch cuts U.S. posted crude oil by 25 cts/bbl.
newsitem.headline: Koch cuts U.S. posted crude oil by 25 cts/bbl.

text.p: Koch Oil said it had lowered the price it will pay for U.S. crude oil by 25 cents, effective Tuesday.
The decrease brings the new price for U.S. benchmark grade West Texas Intermediate to $19.25 a barrel and West Texas Sour to $16.50 a barrel.
Light Louisiana sweet crude is now $18.75 and Oklahoma sweet is $19.25.
